p: A nation of well-developed health and social infrastructure, the physician-based sentinel surveillance conducted by the Ministry of Health reported EV-A71-associated morbidity in 1980, 1981, and 1986 [ 30, 75, 76]. Taiwan experienced the largest epidemic in the year 1998, with an overall attack rate of 43% (Fig.Â 1) [ 30, 31, 77]. Viral transmission decreased during the summer season (July to September), and 2 epidemic waves were identified with peak incidences of 15,758 cases and 3177 cases during the week of June 7 and October 4, respectively [ 30, 31, 33]. In addition, unusual neurological complications were reported. In all, there were approximately 130,000 cases, of which 405 were severe and 78 were fatal [ 1, 30, 31].
